title: Investigate Out-of-Specification Lab Result
description: A QC analyst gets an out-of-specification (OOS) result during product release testing and must initiate an investigation.

tasks.description: Confirm the OOS result by re-testing the sample.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent documents the OOS result (e.g., purity of 98.0% vs. specification of >=99.0%) and the confirmatory result.

tasks.description: Initiate a Phase 1 lab investigation in the quality management system.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent creates a new lab investigation record and documents the initial findings.

tasks.description: Review instrument calibration records and analyst training files to rule out obvious lab error.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent verifies that the instrument was calibrated and the analyst was properly trained, finding no evidence of lab error.

tasks.description: Escalate the investigation to a full Phase 2 investigation involving the manufacturing department.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent escalates the OOS record and assigns tasks to the manufacturing team to review the batch record.
